text.value: Turns towards the origin of sound
Extend hand to grasp a toy
Cereals (Maize, Rice, Millet, Wheat, Oats, Ugali, Poridge, Chapati) White Tubers and Roots (Potatoes, Cassava, Yams, Arrow roots, Green cooked bananas, plantain)
Beans and Pulses (Beans, Peas, Soya beans, green grams, lentils)
Nuts and seeds (Pumpin, amaranath, sunflower, simsim, groundnut, macadamia, cashew nuts)
Meat, Fish, Poultry, Insects (Goat meat, game meat, pork, beef, rabbit, chicken, tilapia)
orange/yellow fruits and vegetables (carrots, pumpkin, butternut, orange)
Dark green vegetables (Spinach, Sukumawiki, kunde, bean leaves, managu, terere, saga)
Other Vegetables (Green Paper, onions, cauliflower, cabbage, cucumber, egg plant, cougettes)
Other Fruits (Guava, avocado, pineaples, green plums, green grapes, apples, ripe bananas)

bind.calculate: selected(../no_move, 'yes') or selected(../has_yellow_soles, 'yes') or selected(../bleeding_umbilical_stump, 'yes') or selected(../local_infection_signs, 'yes') or selected(../birth_weight_chart, 'yes') or /u5_assessment/u2_month_assessment/u2_has_high_temp ='true' or (../child_temp != '' and /u5_assessment/u2_month_assessment/u2_has_low_temp ='true') or selected(../convusled_or_fitted, 'yes') or selected(../cannot_feed, 'yes') or selected(../chest_indrawing, 'yes')

../breath_count != '' and ( /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months > 2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months <= 12 and ../breath_count >= 50) or ( /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months > 12 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_years <= 5 and ../breath_count >= 40)

selected(../chest_indrawing, 'yes') or /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_diarrhoea_danger_sign = 'true' or selected(../blood_in_stool, 'yes') or /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_fever_danger_sign = 'true' or selected(../has_convulsions, 'yes') or selected(../cannot_drink_feed, 'yes') or selected(../is_vomiting_everything, 'yes') or selected(../is_sleepy_unconscious, 'yes') or selected(../has_taken_al, 'yes') or /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_has_low_temp = 'true' or /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_has_high_temp ='true'

bind.jr:constraintMsg: Cannot select None with other options

bind.calculate: ( /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months <= 6 and selected(../is_breastfeeding_exclusively, 'no')) or ( /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 6 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months <= 24 and selected(../still_breastfeeding, 'no'))

bind.jr:constraintMsg: All eligible vaccines need to be selected if the immunization status is up to date
None cannot be selected with any other option!

bind.calculate: if(selected(../upto_date_insurance, 'yes'),"Up to date","Not up to date")

selected(../../u5_assessment/has_contact_with_tb, 'yes') or selected(../../u5_assessment/has_cough, 'yes') or /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_has_fast_breathing ='true' or selected(../../u5_assessment/has_diarrhoea, 'yes') or selected(../../u5_assessment/has_fever, 'yes') or selected(../../group_sgbv/has_observed_signs_of_violence, 'yes') or (selected(../../u5_assessment/has_cough, 'yes') and /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_has_fast_breathing ='false') or selected(../../malnutrition_screening/non_treatable_condition, 'yes')

(selected(../../u5_assessment/has_cough, 'yes') and /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_has_fast_breathing ='false') or ( /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_has_fast_breathing ='true' and /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/u5_dangersigns_excludes_fast_breathing ='false') or (selected(../../u5_assessment/has_diarrhoea, 'yes')) or ( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_show_malaria_section ='true') or ( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_show_fever_section ='true') or (selected(../../malnutrition_screening/muac_color, 'yellow')) or (selected(../../deworming/deworming_upto_date, 'no'))

selected(../../u5_assessment/chest_indrawing, 'yes') and selected(../../u5_assessment/blood_in_stool, 'yes') and selected(../../u5_assessment/has_convulsions, 'yes') and selected(../../u5_assessment/cannot_drink_feed, 'yes') and selected(../../u5_assessment/is_vomiting_everything, 'yes') and selected(../../u5_assessment/is_sleepy_unconscious, 'yes') and /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_diarrhoea_danger_sign = 'true' and /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_fever_danger_sign ='true'

bind.jr:constraintMsg: Total selected tablets must equal number of tablets given
Total selected tablets must equal number of tablets given
Total selected tablets must equal number of tablets given
Total selected tablets must equal number of tablets given

bind.calculate: if( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_al_num_tablets_from_6_pack = '',int(0), int( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_al_num_tablets_from_6_pack )) + if( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_al_num_tablets_from_12_pack = '',int(0), int( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_al_num_tablets_from_12_pack )) + if( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_al_num_tablets_from_18_pack = '',int(0), int( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_al_num_tablets_from_18_pack )) + if( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_al_num_tablets_from_24_pack = '',int(0), int( /u5_assessment/group_summary_no_danger_signs/r_al_num_tablets_from_24_pack ))

( /u5_assessment/malaria_screening/malaria_test_positive ='true' or selected(../../u5_assessment/has_fever, 'yes') or /u5_assessment/u5_assessment/u5_has_high_temp ='true') and selected(../../u5_assessment/has_convulsions, 'no') and selected(../../u5_assessment/cannot_drink_feed, 'no')and selected(../../u5_assessment/is_vomiting_everything, 'no') and selected(../../u5_assessment/is_sleepy_unconscious, 'no')

selected(../../deworming/deworming_upto_date, 'no') or selected(../../malnutrition_screening/muac_color, 'yellow') or selected(../../immunization_screening/imm_schedule_upto_date, 'no') or selected(../r_given_paracetamol, 'no') or selected(../r_given_al, 'no') or selected(../r_given_ors, 'no') or selected(../r_given_zinc, 'no') or selected(../r_given_amox, 'no') or selected( /u5_assessment/malnutrition_screening/non_treatable_condition , 'yes')

select1.label: Is sick?
Who is the caregiver today?

input.label: Does have any of the following danger signs?

select1.label: Not able to feed since birth, or stopped feeding well
Convulsed or fitted since birth.

input.label: Press the timer and count number of breaths for a full 60 seconds two times Fast breathing is when you count 60 breaths or more twice. (Use a watch or timer)
Look for chest indrawing (the child should be calm, and not breastfeeding or eating. If asleep, try not to wake up the child)

select1.label: Is there severe chest in-drawing? (lower part of the chest draws in as the baby breaths in)
Does have a fever (hotness of the body)?

input.label: Use your thermometer to take the patient's temperature. Ensure you clean the thermometer with surgical spirit in cotton wool before and after use.

select1.label: Only moves when stimulated, or does not move even on stimulation.
Yellow soles
Bleeding from the umbilical stump
Signs of local infection: umbilicus red or draining pus, skin boils, or eyes draining pus
Birth weight chart using color coded scales if RED or Yellow (refer < 2.5kgs or those born less than 36 weeks of age)

input.label: Refer the child immediately to the health facility

select1.label: Does have a cough?
Any history of contact with person(s) with TB in the family/household?

input.label: Refer immediately to the health facility
Press the timer and count number of breaths for a full 60 seconds Repeat the count if you had difficulties in counting

select1.label: Is there chest in-drawing?

input.label: Chest in-drawing is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assesment and counseling

select1.label: Does have diarrhoea (3 or more loose stools in 24 hrs)?
How many days has the diarrhoea lasted?

input.label: Diarrhoea for 14 days or more is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assesment and counseling

select1.label: Is there blood in the Stool?

input.label: Blood in stool is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assesment and counseling

select1.label: Has had or currently have hotness of body?
How many days has the fever lasted (hotness of the body) ?

input.label: Fever for 7 days or more is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assesment and counseling

select1.label: Do you have a thermometer?

input.label: Use your thermometer to take the patient's temperature. Ensure you clean the thermometer with surgical spirit in cotton wool before and after use.
High temperature, Refer to the health facility
Low temperature, Refer to the health facility

select1.label: Has had Convulsions?

input.label: Convulsion is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assesment and counseling

select1.label: Does have difficulty drinking or feeding?
Is not able to drink or feed anything?

input.label: Not able to drink or feed anything is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assesment and counseling

select1.label: Is Vomiting?
Is vomiting everything?

input.label: Vomiting everything is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assesment and counseling

select1.label: Is unusually sleepy or unconscious?

input.label: Unusually sleepy or unconscious is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assesment and counseling

select1.label: Has taken AL in the last one week?

input.label: Refer immediately to the health facility

select1.label: Rapid Malaria Tests Results
Repeat Rapid Malaria Tests Results

input.label: MESSAGE TO CHV: Refer the client to health facility for malaria testing and explain to the client the importance of malaria diagnosis

group.label: Assess child for malnutrition using Mid Upper Arm Circumference (MUAC) assessment

select1.label: What is the MUAC color?

input.label: Red on MUAC is a danger sign. Refer to the health facility
Counsel Mother to maintain proper feeding and continue breastfeeding for at least 2 years
Yellow on MUAC tape: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assessment and counselling
Provide health education on breast feeding and complimentary feeding and Refer for further nutritional assessment.

select1.label: Check for swelling of both feet by pressing both feet for 3 seconds. Is there swelling of both feet?

input.label: Swelling of both feet is a danger sign: Refer to the health facility for further nutritional assessment and counselling

select1.label: Does the child have any other problem or condition you cannot treat?
Does mother know their HIV status?

input.label: Health Educate on the importance of knowing ones HIV status and Encourage them to go the health facility
One should be tested every three months.
Health Educate on the importance of adherence to medication if necessary.

select1.label: Is the mother exclusively breastfeeding the child?

input.label: Breast milk is the best food for your baby. Mother's milk contains all the liquid and food a child needs for the first six months. Breastfeed whenever the baby wants, both day and night so that they get enough milk. Be sure to empty one breast before switching to the other. Do not give other foods and drinks like water or juice.
Frequently breastfeed your baby to produce more breast milk. Be sure to empty one breast before switching to the other. Breastfeeding is Best feeding!
Note for CHV: If the mother is not breastfeeding due to an issue, such as latching problems, malnutrition etc, Refer to the health facility.

select1.label: Is the mother still breastfeeding the child?
Did the mother breastfeed her child in the last 24 hours?

input.label: Message to caregiver: Continue breastfeeding. After 6 months, your child's body is ready to accept food and now needs food in addition to breast milk to get enough energy and nutrition. Prepare safe adequate complementary foods to feed your child. An adequate complementary diet comprises of 4 out of the 7 food groups for children aged 6 months up to 5 years (Grain, grain products and other starchy foods, legumes/pulses, nuts and seeds, dairy and dairy products, flesh foods (meat, poultry, fish, organ meat, insects), eggs, vitamin A rich fruits and vegetables and other fruits and vegetables).

Message to caregiver: Continue breastfeeding as often as the child wants both day and night. Your baby still needs breast milk to grow well and fight disease.Prepare safe adequate complementary foods to feed your child. An adequate complementary diet comprises of 4 out of the 7 food groups for children aged 6 months up to 5 years (Grain, grain products and other starchy foods, legumes/pulses, nuts and seeds, dairy and dairy products, flesh foods (meat, poultry, fish, organ meat, insects), eggs, vitamin A rich fruits and vegetables and other fruits and vegetables)
Refer the child to the health facility for nutritional counselling

select1.label: Has taken any solid or semisolid food in the past 24 hours?

select.label: Did eat any of the following food groups in the last 24 hours?

item.label: Cereals (Maize, Rice, Millet, Wheat, Oats, Ugali, Poridge, Chapati) White Tubers and Roots (Potatoes, Cassava, Yams, Arrow roots, Green cooked bananas, plantain)
Beans and Pulses (Beans, Peas, Soya beans, green grams, lentils)
Nuts and seeds (Pumpin, amaranath, sunflower, simsim, groundnut, macadamia, cashew nuts)
Meat, Fish, Poultry, Insects (Goat meat, game meat, pork, beef, rabbit, chicken, tilapia)
orange/yellow fruits and vegetables (carrots, pumpkin, butternut, orange)
Dark green vegetables (Spinach, Sukumawiki, kunde, bean leaves, managu, terere, saga)
Other Vegetables (Green Paper, onions, cauliflower, cabbage, cucumber, egg plant, cougettes)
Other Fruits (Guava, avocado, pineaples, green plums, green grapes, apples, ripe bananas)

input.label: Message to Care giver: Prepare safe adequate complementary foods to feed your child. An adequate complementary diet comprises of 4 out of the 7 food groups for children aged 6 months up to 5 years (Grain, grain products and other starchy foods, legumes/pulses, nuts and seeds, dairy and dairy products, flesh foods (meat, poultry, fish, organ meat, insects), eggs, vitamin A rich fruits and vegetables and other fruits and vegetables).

Message to CHV: Advise the caregiver on importance of feeding their children on adequate complementary diet. Message to Care giver: Prepare safe adequate complementary foods to feed your child. An adequate complementary diet comprises of 4 out of the 7 food groups for children aged 6 months up to 5 years (Grain, grain products and other starchy foods, legumes/pulses, nuts and seeds, dairy and dairy products, flesh foods (meat, poultry, fish, organ meat, insects), eggs, vitamin A rich fruits and vegetables and other fruits and vegetables)

select1.label: Is the immunization schedule up to date?
Indicate the source of the Immunization information

select.label: Tick all vaccines that were given

itemset.nodeset: instance('vaccines')/root/item[ /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks != '' and ( (name = 'bcg' and name != /u5_assessment/bcg and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_days >= 0) or (name = 'opv0' and name != /u5_assessment/opv0 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_days >= 0) or (name = 'opv1' and name != /u5_assessment/opv1 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 6) or (name = 'opv2' and name != /u5_assessment/opv2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 10) or (name = 'opv3' and name != /u5_assessment/opv3 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'pcv1' and name != /u5_assessment/pcv1 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 6) or (name = 'pcv2' and name != /u5_assessment/pcv2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 10) or (name = 'pcv3' and name != /u5_assessment/pcv3 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'penta1' and name != /u5_assessment/penta1 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 6) or (name = 'penta2' and name != /u5_assessment/penta2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 10) or (name = 'penta3' and name != /u5_assessment/penta3 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'ipv' and name != /u5_assessment/ipv and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'rota1' and name != /u5_assessment/rota1 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 6) or (name = 'rota2' and name != /u5_assessment/rota2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 10) or (name = 'rota3' and name != /u5_assessment/rota3 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'vit_a' and name != /u5_assessment/vit_a and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 6) or (name = 'measles_9' and (name != /u5_assessment/measles_9 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 9)) or (name = 'measles_18' and (name != /u5_assessment/measles_18 and ( /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 18))) )]

select.label: Tick these vaccines if they were given

itemset.nodeset: instance('optional_vaccines')/root/item[ /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks != '' and ( (name = 'measles_6' and (name != /u5_assessment/measles_6 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 6)) or (name = 'malaria' and name != /u5_assessment/malaria_vaccine ) )]

input.label: Message to CHV: Thank the caregiver for ensuring that their child's immunization status is completed. Encourage the caregiver to ensure that the child receives Vitamin A every 6 months until the child is 5 years old
Message to caregiver: Explain to the caregiver the importance of immunization. REFER the child to the nearest Health Center where the child can be immunised.

Message to CHV: Remind the caregiver which vaccines the child has not received, their importance and when the child should have received them. REFER the child to the nearest Health Center where the child can be immunised.

select.label: Tick all the vaccines you are referring the child for

itemset.nodeset: instance('vaccines')/root/item[ /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks != '' and ( (name = 'bcg' and name != /u5_assessment/bcg and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_days >= 0) or (name = 'opv0' and name != /u5_assessment/opv0 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_days >= 0) or (name = 'opv1' and name != /u5_assessment/opv1 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 6) or (name = 'opv2' and name != /u5_assessment/opv2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 10) or (name = 'opv3' and name != /u5_assessment/opv3 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'pcv1' and name != /u5_assessment/pcv1 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 6) or (name = 'pcv2' and name != /u5_assessment/pcv2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 10) or (name = 'pcv3' and name != /u5_assessment/pcv3 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'penta1' and name != /u5_assessment/penta1 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 6) or (name = 'penta2' and name != /u5_assessment/penta2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 10) or (name = 'penta3' and name != /u5_assessment/penta3 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'ipv' and name != /u5_assessment/ipv and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'rota1' and name != /u5_assessment/rota1 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 6) or (name = 'rota2' and name != /u5_assessment/rota2 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 10) or (name = 'rota3' and name != /u5_assessment/rota3 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks >= 14) or (name = 'vit_a' and name != /u5_assessment/vit_a and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 6) or (name = 'measles_6' and (name != /u5_assessment/measles_6 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 6)) or (name = 'measles_9' and (name != /u5_assessment/measles_9 and /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 9)) or (name = 'measles_18' and (name != /u5_assessment/measles_18 and ( /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_months >= 18))) )]

select.label: Which Vit A dose has received?

itemset.nodeset: instance('vitamin_a_doses')/root/item[(age_limit_lower <= /u5_assessment/patient_age_in_weeks and (dose_6_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_6 or dose_12_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_12 or dose_18_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_18 or dose_24_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_24 or dose_30_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_30 or dose_36_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_36 or dose_42_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_42 or dose_48_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_48 or dose_54_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_54 or dose_60_months_group != /u5_assessment/vit_a_60 or all = 1))]

input.label: Message to CHV:Advice the care giver that Vitamin A promotes good vision, boosts immunity and promotes growth and development and Refer to the health facility

select1.label: Is deworming status up to date?

input.label: Advice the care giver that deworming prevents worms which interferes with growth and development of a child
Check the Mother and Child Health (MCH) Handbook or other source of data

select1.label: Is participating in monthly growth monitoring?

input.label: Advice the primary caregiver on importance of regular checking the weight of the baby and encourage them to take the child to the clinic for monthly growth monitoring

Developmental milestones include
  1. Social Smile: for children between age 4 to 6 weeks
  2. Head Holding/Control: for children between age 1 to 3 months
  3. Turns towards the origin of sound: for children between age 2 to 3 months
  4. Extend hand to grasp a toy: for children between age 2 to 3 months
  5. Sitting: for children between age 5 to 9 months
  6. Standing: for children between age 7 to13 months
  7. Walking: for children between age 12 to18 months
  8. Talking: for children between age 19 to 24 months

select1.label: Is showing signs of delayed developmental milestones?

select.label: Select the delayed developmental milestones is showing

input.label: Refer to the health facility for further assessment.
**Observe for signs of any form of violence and notify the CHA.**

select1.label: Have you observed sign(s) of any form of violence?
Have you referred them to the CHA?
Does have up to date insurance?

input.label: Encourage caregiver to get an insurance cover if they don't have or to update their insurance cover.
Congratulate caregiver and encourage them to continue updating their insurance cover.
Be sure you Submit to complete this form.
Immunization status: Not up to date
Deworming status: Not up to date
Vitamin A status: Not up to date
Vitamin A status: Up to date
Has history of contact of persons with TB in the family/household
If No Danger Sign Treat at Home

Sooth the throat and relieve the cough with a safe remedy (warm fluids, lemon with honey, breast milk) Advise the caregiver to increase fluids. Advice caregiver not to give any drugs to the child for this condition. Advice caregiver when to go to the health facility immediately (WHEN TO RETURN).
Continue with exclusive breastfeeding and contact the CHV in case the cough persists

select1.label: Has taken Amoxicillin Dispersible Tablet (DT) in the last one week?

input.label: Give 1 tablet of Amoxicillin Dispersable Tablet 250mg (DT) every 12 hours for 5 days. A full dosage is 1 tablet every 12 hours for 5 days. A total of 10 tablets
Give 2 tablets of Amoxicillin Dispersable Tablet 250mg (DT) every 12 hours for 5 days. A full dosage is 2 tablets every 12 hours for 5 days. A total of 20 tablets

Help the caregiver give first dose of amoxicillin DT now. This is an antibiotic, ensure to complete the entire dose. Take after meals. Follow up the child in two days and if no improvement, refer the child to the health facility immediately

select1.label: Have you given Amoxicillin Dispersable Tablet 250mg (DT)?
Please give reasons why.

input.label: How many tablets of Amoxicillin Dispersible Tablet 250mg (DT) did you give?
Dilute 1 sachet in half a litre of water and give to the child until they are no longer thirsty.

select1.label: Have you given ORS?
Please give reasons why.

input.label: How many sachets of ORS did you give?
Give zinc supplement. Give 1 dose daily for 10 days
Give 1/2 tablet (total 10 tablets) Break a tablet, give child a half and throw away the other half
Give 1 tablet (total 10 tablets) Help caregiver to give first dose now

select1.label: Have you given Zinc
Please give reasons why.

input.label: How many tablets of Zinc did you give?
Give small sips of ORS frequently from a cup. If child vomits wait for 10 minutes and give again
Keep ORS solution in a clean, covered container
After 12hrs ask the caregiver to pour out the solution and make a fresh one
Ask the caregiver to put the Zinc tablet into a spoon with breast milk or water so that it can dissolve
Continue giving extra fluid until the diarrhoea stops
Recommended home fluids include; soup, uji, sour milk, coconut water, clean safe water, breast milk (for those who are still breastfeeding
Go to the health facility immediately if child becomes sicker or develops any danger sign
Malaria rapid diagnostic test result: Positive

Give 1 tablet as per the instructions for 3 days. A total of 6 tablets Give one tablet immediately, second dose after 8 hours. Give third dose 24 hours after the first dose and subsequent doses every 12 hours until completion of the doses

Give 2 tablets as per the instructions for 3 days. A total of 12 tablets Give two tablets immediately, second dose after 8 hours. Give third dose 24 hours after the first dose and subsequent doses every 12 hours until completion of the doses.

select1.label: Have you given AL?
Please give reasons why.
How many tablets of AL did you give?
How many tablets did you pick from the 6 pack?
How many tablets did you pick from the 12 pack?
How many tablets did you pick from the 18 pack?
How many tablets did you pick from the 24 pack?

input.label: Advice the care giver to give : the 2nd dose 8hours after the first dose the 3rd dose 24hours after the first dose( same time the 1st dose was given) 4th dose 12hours from the 3rd dose 5th dose 12hours from the 4th dose and 6th dose 12hours from the 5th dose Remind the caregiver to give the full dose as recommended

select1.label: Have you given Paracetamol?
Syrup or tablets?

input.label: Give 2.5ml (1/2 tsp) every 8 hours for three days
Give 5ml (1 tsp) every eight hours for three days
Give 7.5ml every eight hours for three days
Give 1/8 tablet every 8 hours for three days
Give 1/4 tablet every eight hours for three days
Give 1/2 tablet every eight hours for three days

select1.label: Please give reasons why.

input.label: Help the caregiver give first dose of paracetamol now. Advice the caregiver to give the full dose as recommended
Important Instructions for yellow on MUAC
Counsel caregiver on feeding and refer the child to a supplementary feeding programme / health facility

select1.label: Have you dewormed the child?
Please give reasons why.

input.label: Advice to Caregiver For ALL children treated at home

• – Advise caregiver to give more fluids and continue feeding.
  • – Advise on when to return. Go to nearest health facility immediately or if not possible return if child:
    • Cannot drink or feed
    • Becomes sicker
    • Has blood in the stool
  • - Advise caregiver on use of a bed net (LLITN).

Message to CHV:
  • – For any sick child below six months encourage exclusive breastfeeding For children 6months and above who can drink, advise to give fluids and continue feeding.
  • – Advise to keep child warm, if child has NO fever.
  • – If you are out of stock refer to the health facility.
  • – Follow up child on return at least once a week until child is well.
Child already on amoxicillin DT or Child not given amoxicillin DT
Child not given ORS and Zinc
Child's Immunization status is not up to date or/and if there is no written information
A Referral Follow up task will appear within 3 days
Follow up (Pneumonia) A Treatment Follow up task will appear within 48 hrs
Follow up (Diarrhoea, Fever, Cough,) A Treatment Follow up task will appear within 48 hrs
Be sure you Submit to complete this form.
Not able to feed since birth, or stopped feeding well
Only moves when stimulated, or does not move even on stimulation.
Signs of local infection: umbilicus red or draining pus, skin boils, or eyes draining pus

Message to CHV: For any sick child below six months encourage exclusive breastfeeding For children 6months and above who can drink, advise to give fluids and continue feeding. Advise to keep child warm, if child has NO fever. If you are out of stock refer to the health facility.
FOLLOW UP child on return at least once a week until child is well.
Danger Signs! Give Pre-Referral Treatment and Refer to the Health Facility
Other condition that cannot be treated at home
Soothe the throat and relieve the cough with a safe remedy (warm fluids, lemon with honey, breast milk) Advise the caregiver to increase fluids.
Has taken Amoxicillin Dispersible Tablet 250mg (DT) in the last one week?
Give first dose of oral Amoxicilin Dispersible Tablet 250 mg (DT) and refer to the health facility

**Give 1 tablet**
*A full dosage is 1 tablet every 12 hours for 5 days. A total of 10 tablets*

**Give 2 tablets**
*A full dosage is 2 tablet every 12 hours for 5 days. A total of 20 tablets*

Help the caregiver give first dose of Amoxicillin Dispersible Tablet 250mg (DT) now and refer the child to the health facility immediately. Follow up the child in 24hrs to find out if the child was taken to the health facility

input.label: How many tablets of Amoxicillin Dispersible Tablet 250mg (DT) did you give?
Begin giving ORS solution right away
Dilute 1 sachet in half a litre of water and give to the child until they are no longer thirsty.

select1.label: Have you given ORS?
Please give reasons why.

input.label: How many sachets of ORS did you give?

Give 1/2 a tablet of Zinc
Break a tablet, give child a half and throw away the other half
*A full dosage is ½ a tablet daily for 10 days. A total of 10 tablets.*

Give 1 tablet of Zinc. Help the caregiver to give first dose now
*A full dosage is 1 tablet daily for 10 days. A total of 10 tablets*

select1.label: Have you given Zinc?
Please give reasons why.

input.label: How many tablets of Zinc did you give?
Give small sips of ORS frequently from a cup. If child vomits wait for 10 minutes and give again
Keep ORS solution in a clean, covered container
After 12hrs ask the caregiver to pour out the solution and make a fresh one
Ask the caregiver to put the Zinc tablet into a spoon with breast milk or water so that it can dissolve
Continue giving extra fluid until the diarrhoea stops
Recommended home fluids include; soup, uji, sour milk, coconut water, clean safe water, breast milk (for those who are still breastfeeding
Go to the health facility immediately if child becomes sicker or develops any danger sign
Give first dose of oral paracetamol (500mg)

select1.label: Have you given Paracetamol?
Please give reasons why.
Select the dispensing unit of Paracetamol

input.label: How many bottles of Paracetamol (5ml) did you give?
How many tablets of Paracetamol (500mg) did you give?
Give the first dose of paracetamol syrup 2.5ml (1/2 tsp) and refer to the health facility. A Full dose is 2.5 ml (1/2 tsp) every 8 hours for three days.
Give the first dose of paracetamol syrup (1 tsp) and refer to the health facility. A Full dose is 5ml (1 tsp) every eight hours for three days.
Give the first dose of paracetamol syrup 7.5ml (1 1/2 tsp) and refer to the health facility. A Full dose is 7.5ml (1 1/2 tsp) every eight hours for three days.
"Give the first dose of paracetamol (500 mg) 1/8 tablet and refer to the health facility. A Full dose is1/8 tablet every 8 hours for three days"
"Give the first dose of paracetamol (500 mg) 1/4 tablet and refer to the health facility. A Full dose is 1/4 tablet every 8 hours for three days"
"Give the first dose of paracetamol (500 mg) 1/2 tablet and refer to the health facility. A Full dose is 1/4 tablet every 8 hours for three days"
Help the caregiver give first dose of paracetamol now. Refer the child to the health facility and advice the caregiver to immediately take the child to the health facility.
Feed your child only on breast milk for the first 6 months

Introduce other nutritious foods at 6 months and continue to breastfeed up to 2 years and beyond. Prepare safe adequate complementary foods to feed your child. An adequate complementary diet comprises of 4 out of the 7 food groups for children aged 6 months upto 5 years (Grain, grain products and other starchy foods, legumes/pulses, nuts and seeds, dairy and dairy products, flesh foods (meat, poultry, fish, organ meat, insects), eggs, vitamin A rich fruits and vegetables and other fruits and vegetables). Avoid giving commercially sweetened drinks, e.g juices and sodas, which have additives.
A Referral Follow up task will appear in 24 hrs
